revised_title: The Pathology of Dropsy Produced by Obstruction of the Superior and Inferior Venae Caves and the Portal Vein
tldr: The author conducted experiments to study the effects of obstructing the superior and inferior venae cavae and the portal vein on the body. They found that complete obstruction led to dropsy, while partial obstruction could result in survival with established anastomoses. The study challenges Starling's theory of hydrsemic plethora and provides insights into the underlying principles of both local and general venous obstruction.
